DataElement.preferredName: Patient Follow-up and Health Care Provider Training Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes no indicator to specify whether the patient has a routine follow-up visit with a trained provider

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Follow-up Scheduled and Provider Training Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Related to a scheduled follow-up with a trained health care provider

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Follow-up Scheduled Health Care Provider Training Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.:To order a planned list of activities or events.:Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.:To teach with hands-on experience:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
To order a planned list of activities or events.
Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scheduled for a routine cance
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scheduled for a routine cancer-related follow-up care visit within the next 30 days with a provider who received training to use AH-HA.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1804CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scheduled for a routine cancer-related follow-up care visit (for one of the cancer types listed in 4.2.1) within the next 30 days with a provider participating in the study (in the intervention arm, this is a provider who received training to use AH-HA).
